title: Introduction to Analog Systems and Circuits
description: Circuit theory and applications of passive components and Op amps. Introduction to analog systems using differential equations and Laplace transforms.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering

title: Introduction to Analog Systems and Circuits for Transfer Students Lecture
description: Lecture-only component of ECE 2020, for transfer students.  Circuit theory and applications of passive components and Op amps.  Introduction to analog systems using differential equations and Laplace transforms.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Math 1152 or 1161.01 or 1161.02 or 1172 or 1181H, and Physics 1250, 1250H or 1260, and CSE 1222 or 2221 or Engr 1281.01H or 1281.02H or 1222; and Engr 1182.01 or 1182.02 or 1182.03 or 1282.01H or 1282.02H or 1282.03H, or Engr 1186 and 1187 and concur: 1188 concurrent, or 1187 and 1188 and concur: 1186; and CPHR 2.00 or above.

title: Introduction to Analog Systems and Circuits Lab for Transfer Students
description: Laboratory-only component of ECE 2020, for transfer students.  Laboratory practice with circuit theory, analog systems, and applications of passive components and Op amps.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq:  2021, and CPHR 2.00 or above.

title: Introduction to Discrete Time Signals and Systems
description: Introduction to sampled time signals and linear time invariant sampled time systems.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 2060, 2000, or 2061 and 2067; and CSE 1222. Prereq or concur: Math 2174 or 2568
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 2100, 2100.01, 2100.04, 2104, or 2110.

title: Introduction to Discrete Time Signals & Systems Lecture
description: Introduction to sampled time signals and linear time invariant sampled time systems. Lecture only.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 2000, or 2060, or 2061 and 2067. Prereq or concur: Math 2174 or 2568.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 2100, 2100.01, 2100.04, 2104, 2110, or 2050.

title: Introduction to Discrete Time Signals & Systems Laboratory
description: Introduction to samples time signals and linear time invariant sampled time systems. Lab only.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq or concur: 2051.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 2100, 2100.01, 2100.04, 2110, or 2050.

title: Introduction to Digital Logic
description: Introduction to the theory and practice of combinational and clocked sequential networks.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Not open to students with credit for 2000, 2000.02, 2000.07, 2001, 2010 or 2017.

title: Introduction to Digital Logic for Transfer Students Lecture
description: Lecture-only component of ECE 2060, for transfer students.  Introduction to the theory and practice of combinational and clocked sequential networks.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Math 1152 or 1161.01 or 1161.02 or 1172 or 1181H, and Physics 1250, 1250H or 1260, and CSE 1222 or 2221 or Engr 1281.01H or 1281.02H or 1222; and Engr 1182.01 or 1182.02 or 1182.03 or 1282.01H or 1282.02H or 1282.03H, or Engr 1186 and 1187. and concur: 1188 concurrent, or 1187 and 1188 and concur: 1186, or major in CIS or CIS-PRE; and CPHR 2.00 or above.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 2000, 2000.02, 2001, 2010, 2060, 261, 290, or 294.01.

title: Introduction to Digital Logic Lab for Transfer Students
description: Laboratory-only component of ECE 2060 for transfer students.  Laboratory practice with and application of the theory of combinational and clocked sequential networks.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq:  2061, and CPHR 2.00 or above.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 2000, 2000.02, 2000.07, 2017, 2060, 270, 290, or 294.01.

title: Individual Studies in Electrical and Computer Engineering
description: Individual studies project.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Repeatable to a maximum of 12.0 cr hrs or 10 completions. This course is graded S/U. Permission of instructor required.

title: Electrical Circuits and Electronic Devices
description: Introduction to circuit analysis; circuit analysis concepts and mechanical systems analogies; theory and applications of electronic devices; operational amplifiers; electrical instruments and measurements.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Physics 1251  or 1261, and Math 1172 or 1544 or 2153 or 2162.01 or 2162.02 or 2182H or 4182H, and CPHR 2.0 or above, and enrollment in College of Engineering.
exclusions: Not open to students majoring in ECE.

title: Electrical Circuits and Electronic Devices Lecture
description: Introduction to circuit analysis; circuit analysis concepts and mechanical systems analogies; theory and applications of electronic devices; operational amplifiers; electrical instruments and measurements. Lecture portion only.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Physics 1251  or 1261, and Math 1172 or 1544 or 2153 or 2162.01 or 2162.02 or 2182H or 4182H, and CPHR 2.0 or above, and enrollment in College of Engineering.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 2300, or students majoring in ECE.

title: Electrical Circuits and Electronic Devices Laboratory
description: Introduction to circuit analysis; circuit analysis concepts and mechanical systems analogies; applications of electronic devices; operational amplifiers; electrical instruments and measurements. Lab only.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq or concur: 2301.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 2300, or students majoring in ECE.

title: Electronics for CSE Majors
description: Electronics course for CSE majors. Circuit analysis and design around embedded systems.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Engr 1182.01, 1182.02, 1182.03, 1282.01H, 1282.02H, 1282.03H, 1282.04H, or 1186, 1187 and 1188 concurrent; and Math 1152, 1161.01, 1161.02, 1172, or 1181H; and Physics 1250 or 1260; CPHR 2.00 or above, and enrollment in CSE major.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 2020 or 2300.

title: Introduction to Microcontroller-Based Systems
description: Hardware and software organization of a typical microcontroller; machine language programming, interfacing peripheral devices, and input-output programming; real-time computer applications.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 2000, 2001, 2060, or 2061 and prereq or concur: 2000.07 or 2017; and CSE 1221, 1222, Engr 1281.01H, 1281.02H, or 1222, and enrollment in ECE, CSE, or EngPhysics major; or prereq or concur: 2010 or 2067, and permission of department.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for CSE 2421.

title: Undergraduate Research
description: Supervised undergraduate research in various topics.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq:  Permission of instructor.  Repeatable to a maximum of 6.0 cr hrs or 6 completions.

title: Undergraduate Research
description: Supervised undergraduate research in various topics.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq:  Permission of instructor.  Repeatable to a maximum of 6.0 cr hrs or 6 completions.  This course is graded S/U.

title: Introduction to Radio Frequency and Optical Engineering
description: Waves and pulses on transmission lines; charges, fields, and potentials; inductance and capacitance; Faraday’s law; Maxwell’s Equations; plane wave propagation, polarization, reflection, and transmission.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 2020, 2021, 2100, 2100.02, 2100.06, or 2105; and Physics 1251 or 1261, or both 1240 and 1241; and Math 2415 or 2174; and enrollment in ECE or EngPhysics major; or prereq or concur: 2010 or 2061, and permission of department.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 3010.01, 3010.02.

title: Introduction to Electronics
description: Electronics:  diode and transistor models for amplifiers, switches, and logic gates.   Multiple transistor circuit analysis, op amps, and electronic systems.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 2100 or 2020; or 2021 or 2106, and 2027 prereq or concur; and ECE or EngPhys major, or 2110 prereq or concur and permission of department.

title: Electronics Laboratory
description: Electronic amplification, signal processing, timing, and power regulation circuits. Experiments with electronics evaluation modules and use of an analog system lab kit for electronics testing.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3020; and ECE or EngPhysics major.

title: Semiconductor Electronic Devices
description: Semiconductor materials and devices. Crystals; bandstructure; charge carrier statistics; excess carriers, transport; PN junction; Schottky barrier; bipolar and field-effect transistors; optoelectronic devices; nanoscale devices.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Physics 1251, 1261, or both 1240 and 1241; and Chem 1210, 1220, or 1250; and enrollment in ECE, MSE, or EngPhysics major. Prereq or concur: Math 2415 or 2174.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 331 or 432.

title: Sustainable Energy and Power Systems I
description: Introduction to electrical energy systems; history, current trends, renewable and non-renewable sources, rotating machines and their operation, and smart grid initiatives.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 2100, 2100.02, 2105, 2020, 2021, 205, 292 or 294 (Spring 2011), and enrollment in ECE or EngPhysics major.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 341.

title: Electrical Energy Conversion Laboratory
description: Laboratory introducing basics of energy conversion processes for electrical energy supply systems utilizing conventional rotating machines and hardware-in-the-loop simulation system for sustainable energy systems.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3040, and enrollment in ECE or EngPhysics major.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 447

title: Signals and Systems
description: Linear systems and models in continuous and discrete time; convolution; Fourier series and transform; frequency response; Laplace transform; z-transform; applications.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 2020, 2050, and 2060; or 2100; and Math 2568; and enrollment in ECE or EngPhysics major

title: Technical Writing and Presentations
description: Technical writing and communications skills.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: ECE 3905, ENGR 5901.01, or ENGR 5902.02

title: Introduction to Feedback Control Systems
description: Provides fundamental concepts in feedback control systems design and analysis.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 3050

title: Advanced Digital Design
description: Design and analysis of sequential circuits; digital circuit design using building blocks, programmable logic devices; design of basic computer components such as arithmetic logic units.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 2000, 2060, 2061, 2010, 2000.02, 290, 294 (Au10) or 206 and 261.  Prereq or concur: 3020 (323), and enrollment in ECE, EngPhys, or CSE majors; or prereq or concur: 2010, and permission of department.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 561.

title: Microcontroller Lab
description: Laboratory in which a microcontroller is used to interface real-world hardware to make a functioning system.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq:  2560 or CSE 2421, and enrollment in ECE, CSE, or EngPhysics major.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 3567.01 .

title: Capstone Design I
description: Fundamentals of the engineering design process. Application of design principles and methodology to conceptual and detailed technical design. Technical writing and communications skills. Project management during design.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq or concur: 3080 or Philos 1332; and ECE 2560, 3010, 3020, 3027, 3030, 3040, and 3050; and GE Writing/Comm level 2 or Writing and Info Lit; and GenEd 1201 or 2601; and Sr standing; and enrollment in Electrical Eng Program of Study (EES subplan).
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 3900, 3905, 4900, 4900H, 4901, or Engr 5901.01. This course is progress graded.

title: Analog Integrated Circuits I
description: Fundamentals of analog integrated circuits. CMOS transistors and diodes large-signal and small-signal operation and modeling. On-chip passive components operation and modeling. Simple and advanced current mirrors, single-ended and differential CMOS amplifiers, CMOS OTAs and Op-Amps. Integrated Circuits Fabrication, Packaging, and Testing.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3020
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 5021.

title: Individual Studies in Electrical and Computer Engineering
description: Individual studies project.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Repeatable to a maximum of 12.0 cr hrs or 12 completions. This course is graded S/U.

title: Design of Mobile Internet-of-Things
description: This course focuses on theoretical and practical insights into design of Internet of Things architectures and mobile platforms. Concepts covered in this course include general IoT architectures, sensor, processing, and communication resources, device and cloud connectivity, mobility support. Practical aspects will be studied with lab assignments and the semester-long group projects.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering

title: Capstone Design II
description: Application of project management, design principles and methodology to conceptual and detailed technical design, implementation, and testing of a capstone project.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3905 and 3090, or 3906.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 4900, 4900H, 4901, Engr 5901.01, 5901.02H, 5902.01, or 5902.02H

title: Design II with Honors Thesis Project
description: Application of design principles and methodology to conceptual and detailed technical design, implementation and testing, culminating in a capstone design project.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Honors standing; and 3905 and 3090, or 3906; and permission of department.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 4900, 4900H, 4901, Engr 5902.01 or 5902.01H

title: Undergraduate Research
description: Supervised undergraduate research in various topics.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Permission of instructor. Repeatable to a maximum of 6 cr hrs or 6 completions.-

title: Undergraduate Honors Research
description: Supervised research in various topics for undergraduate honors students.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Honors standing; or GPA 3.4 or above, and permission of instructor.  Repeatable to a maximum of 6 cr hrs or 6 completions.

title: Undergraduate Research
description: Supervised undergraduate research in various topics.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Permission of instructor. Repeatable to a maximum of 6 cr hrs or 6 completions. This course is graded S/U.

title: Undergrduate Thesis Research
description: Undergraduate Thesis (Distanction) research on topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq:  GPA 3.0 or above, and enrollment in ECE major, and approved Thesis (Distinction) project.  Repeartable to a maximum of 6 cr hrs or 6 completions.

title: Undergraduate Honors Thesis Research
description: Undergraduate Honors Thesis (Distinction) research on topics in electrical & computer engineering.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Honors Status or minimum GPA of 3.4 and approved Honors Thesis (Distinction) Project.  Repeatable to a maximum of 6 cr hrs or 6 completions.
exclusions: Open only to Electrical and Computer Engineering majors.

title: Introduction to Analog and Digital Communications
description: Communications channel modeling, analog communication schemes, digital communication schemes, error rate analysis, and error control coding.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3050, and Stat 3470 or Physics 3700; or Grad standing.

title: Wireless Propagation and Remote Sensing
description: Practical methods for predicting tropospheric, groundwave, and ionospheric propagation, including refraction, reflection, and extinction effects.  Study of remote sensing systems and their applications.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3010, or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 713.

title: Antennas
description: Electromagnetic radiation; fundamental antenna parameters; dipole, loops, patches, broadband and other antennas; array theory; ground plane effects; horn and reflector antennas; pattern synthesis; antenna measurements.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisites: ECE 3010 or 312 or  or graduate standing in engineering or biological sciences or math & physical sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 711.

title: Integrated Optics
description: Fundamentals of planar lightwave circuits and guided wave devices; laser light in anisotropic media; electrooptic and nonlinear optical effects; concepts in telecommunications, RF photonics, nanobiotechnology.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisites: ECE 3010, or grad standing in engineering or biological sciences or math & physical sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 717.

title: Introduction to Radar Systems
description: Introduces the fundamentals of radar such as the main concepts and techniques used in modern radar systems.  The class is a survey course exposing students to a wide range of radar applications and design issues.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3050, and 3010 or 3010.01, and Stat 3470; or Grad standing in Engr.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 714 or 5194.01.

title: Microwave Engineering
description: Transmission line theory; multiconductor; S-parameters; transformers, couplers, filters, resonators, circulators; electromagnetic interference and compatibility; computer-aided design; microstrip realization and testing with a network analyzer.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3010, and enrollment in ECE major; or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 710.

title: Mixed Signal VLSI
description: Design and circuit analysis of basic VLSI structures such as registers, cell libraries, digital and analog I/O.  Physical layout, timing analysis, PLLs, design tools.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisites: 3020, or graduate standing in engineering or biological sciences or math & physical sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 721.

title: Analog Integrated Circuits II
description: Advanced analog integrated circuits. Linear feedback networks design and stability analysis, multi-stage CMOS op-amp design and compensation, fully-differential op-amps and common-mode feedback networks, comparators, transconductors, bandgaps, sample and hold circuits, switched-capacitor circuits, noise analysis of CMOS circuits.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 4021, or Grad standing in Engineering and permission of instructor.

title: Introduction to RF Systems
description: Intuitive system design methods to dissect the radio modem in analog & digital domains with emphasis on: a) performance evaluation using hand calculations and simulation, and b) understanding of the interaction between RF components and radio architectures. Topics include: system parameters, propagation & antennas, noise, distortion, modulation & aerial access, phase noise, RF transceivers.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq or concur: 4021 or 5021, or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences.

title: Fundamentals of Integrated Data Converters
description:
This course focuses on the fundamentals of Nyquist-rate and oversampled (Delta-Sigma) integrated data
			converters, including system and circuit architectures, performance metrics and characterization, practical
			implementations, and design considerations in advanced semiconductor processes. Nyquist-rate ADC
			architectures covered include flash, two-step, pipelined, SAR, and integrating architectures
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 4021, or Grad standing in Engr or Physics.

title: Power Electronics Devices, Circuits, and Applications
description: The course will provide an introduction to power electronic conversion principles. Analytical techniques will be developed through the study of widely used converter circuits.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE3020 or ECE 323  or graduate standing in engineering or biological sciences or math & physical sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 624, 724 or 844.

title: Microwave Active Circuits
description: Design principles of microwave transistor amplifiers and oscillators; low-noise, power and broadband amplifiers; linearization; computer-aided design; microstrip realizations and testing in the laboratory.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Acceptance in ECE major and ECE 3020 or 323;  or graduate standing in engineering or biological sciences or math & physical sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credits for ECE723

title: Semiconductor Process Technology
description: Discrete and integrated circuit device design, silicon VLSI processing technologies,III-V compound semiconductor device fabrication technologies; epitaxy, doping, bandgap engineering; and device measurements and failure mechanisms.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 3030, or graduate standing in engineering, biological sciences, or math & physical sciences.

title: Surfaces and Interfaces of Electronic Materials
description: Provides the fundamental and practical basis for designing, processing, and characterizing the interfaces controlling the next generations of microelectronic and optoelectronic device structures.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3030, or MatScEn 3271; or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Science, or Math and Physical Sciences.

title: Solid State Electronics & Photonics Lab
description: Introduction to Introduction to laboratory techniques for semiconductor device fabrication including photolithography, oxidation, diffusion, chemical processes, reactive ion etching, and metallization; fabrication and measurements of visible light emitting diodes (LED) and GaN High Electron Mobility Transistor (HEMT).
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq or concur: 3030, and acceptance in ECE, MSE or EngPhysics major; or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences.

title: Electric Machines
description: Principles of electromechanical energy conversion; basic structures of electric machines; steady state models and performance analysis;  Advanced topics on AC machine control.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisites: ECE 3040 or 341, and ECE 3020 or 323;  or graduate standing in engineering or biological sciences or math & physical sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 643 or ECE 743.

title: Power Systems
description: A power system analysis course presenting power systems loads, modeling of transformers and power system model for voltage calculation and faults.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: 3040, or graduate standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 640, 740, or 741.

title: Power Systems - Analysis and Operation
description: Power systems analysis and operations, including steady-state analysis, state estimation, and economic operation.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3040, Sr. standing, and ECE major; or Sr standing and ISE major; and Math 2568; or Grad standing in engineering or biological sciences or math and physical sciences.
exclusions: Cross-listed with ISE 5043.

title: High Voltage Engineering and Laboratory
description: Dielectric strength and breakdown of gases, liquids, and solids, electric field design problems in power system equipment; laboratory study of high voltage insulation.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite:  Acceptance in ECE major, and ECE 3040 or ECE 341;  or graduate standing in engineering or biological sciences or math & physical sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 747.

title: Humanitarian Engineering
description: Poverty and underdevelopment. Goal of social justice. Development strategies. Engineering for the poor, weak, and developing communities. Humanitarianism in the university and engineering enterprise.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: ENGR 1182 or 1282H, or grad standing, or permission of instructor.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ENGR 5050.

title: Empowering the Entrepreneurial Electrical and Computer Engineer
description: This course will teach entrepreneurial minded engineers the process of value creation from their ECE relevant technology or inventions. Topics covered will include self-assessment as an entrepreneur and innovator, analysis and validation of new venture opportunities, intellectual property creation and assessment new venture planning and project management, leadership and team building.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3010, 3020, 3030, 3040, or 3050; or grad standing in Engineering
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 5194.13.

title: Introduction to Wireless Networking
description: Fundamental concepts in cellular design, Wireless-LANs, MANETs, and sensor networks will be explored. Specific topics will include propagation, fading, cellular-design, power-management, routing, scheduling, and control.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Undergrad prereq: 3561 or CSE 3461, and STAT 2450 or 3470.xx. Grad prereq: Grad standing in Engineering or Math and Physical Sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for CSE 5463.  Cross-listed  in CSE 5463.

title: Introduction to Integrated Circuits Test and Measurement
description: Parametric testing techniques for analog, digital, mixed and RF ICs, DSP-based testing; noise effects on accuracy; Design-for-Test and Built-in-Self Tests.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3020, or 323 and 351, or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 625, 694 (Sp09), or 694.04.

title: Power Electronics Lab
description: Laboratory introducing basic circuits of power electronics, and simulation and control hardware and software for various power and energy applications.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: ECE 3040 (341) and enrollment in ECE major, or Grad standing in Engineering.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 628 or 647.

title: Lasers
description:
Atomic interaction with radiation, cavities with gain, optical processes in semiconductors, strain in laser design,
			diode lasers, and advanced semiconductor lasers.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3010 and 3030, or graduate standing in engineering or biological sciences or math & physical sciences.
exclusions: Not open to student with credit for ECE 732.

title: Photonics
description: Fiber optics, optical systems and devices, optical detection, photonic band gaps, holography, and optical data storage.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3010, 3010.01, or 3010.02, and 3030 or 3030.01; or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 5132.01.

title: Introduction to Digital Signal Processing
description:
Sampling and reconstruction; discrete-time rate conversion; processing of discrete-time signals; design of
			discrete-time filters, selected topics in adaptive filtering, time-frequency analysis, and wavelets.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3050, and Stat 3470 or Math 4530; or Grad standing.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 600 or 801.01.

title: Medical Imaging and Processing
description: Introduction to medical imaging techniques (CT, MRI, PET, ultrasound), including data collection, image reconstruction, physics of tissue interactions, and digital processing of medical images.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites:
Undergrad Prereq: 3050, and Concur: 3905; or BME 4110, and Concur: 3701. Grad Prereq: Grad standing in
			ECE, BiomedE, or Biophys
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for BME 5160. Cross-listed in BME 5160.

title: Fundamentals of Power Management Integrated Circuits for VLSI Systems
description: Theory, design and applications of integrated power management integrated circuits in VLSI systems. This includes: system and circuit architectures, performance metrics, practical implementations, design considerations in VLSI systems in advanced CMOS processes, and design techniques for integrated power regulators and battery chargers. Background in basic analog design is strongly recommended.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq:  4021, or Grad standing in Engineering or Physics.

title: Si and Wide Band Gap Power Devices
description: Basic design and operation of Si and Wide Band Gap (WBG: SiC, GaN and ultra wide band gap semiconductors) power devices and the applications of commercial devices in power electronics applications. Trade-offs between various devices. Static and dynamic operation. Comparison of Si and SiC devices and design differences.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3030, or MatScEn 3271; or Grad standing in Engr or Physics
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 5194.07 or 5234.

title: Introduction to Machine Learning for ECE
description:
Introduction to Machine Learning. Coverage includes linear regression, linear classification, model and feature
			selection, neural networks, clustering, and principle components analysis. Python will be used for implementation examples.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: CSE 1222 or Engr 1281.xx, and Math 2568 and Stat 3470, and enrollment in ECE major; or Grad standing.
exclusions:
Not open to students with credit for 4194.02 (Sp19, Machine Learning), 4300, 5300, or MechEng 5194 (Au19,
			Applied ML for MAE).

title: Computer Architecture and Design
description: Design of general purpose digital computers including arithmetic and control units, input/output, and memory subsystems.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 2560 and 3561, and undergraduate enrollment in ECE, CSE, or EngPhysics major; or Grad standing in Engineering.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for CSE 3421.

title: Instrumentation, Signals, and Control in Transportation Applications
description: Interdisciplinary course bringing together electrical engineering tools and transportation applications. Students gain valuable experience working in teams while learning traffic flow, surveillance and control.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 2020 and 2050, and Math 2415; or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences, or permission of instructor
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for CivilEn 4750 or 6750. Crosslisted in CivilEn 5750.

title: Image Processing
description: Fundamentals and research directions in image processing: cameras, geometry, calibration, 2D and 3D image reconstruction, stereo, structure from motion, Radiometry, filtering, motion estimation, and applications.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Stat 3470, and Math 2568; or Grad standing in Engr, BioSci, Stat, BioMinf, or PhysSci.

title: Introduction to Real Time Robotics Systems
description: Components of a robot system, robot forward and reverse kinematics; robot dynamics; robot force generation, robot trajectory generation.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Math 2177 or 2174, or 2415 and 2568; and Physics 1250, 1250H, 1260, or 2300; and CSE 1221, 1222, Engr 1181, 1281.01H, 1281.02H, 1221, or 1222; or Grad standing in Engr; or permission of instructor. Cross-listed in MechEng.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for MechEng 5463 or 7752.

title: Embedded Computer Systems
description: This course introduces the design priniples, analysis methods and case studies of microprocessor-based and time-critical embedded systems, such as sensor and actuator networks, multimedia devices, mobile phones, and avionics. Topics include real-time operating systems, processor scheduling, performance control, resource management, power-aware design, enery optimization, etc.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 5362, or Grad standing in Engr.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 8194.03.

title: Nonlinear and Dynamic Programming for ECE
description:
Introduction to Optimization, including unconstrained optimization, gradient descent, Newton?s method,
			convexity, constrained optimization, KKT, duality, dynamic programming, basic reinforcement learning, and
			applications of optimization in ECE.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Math 2568 and 2415; or Grad standing in Engineering or Math and Physical Sciences
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 5759.

title: Introduction to Computational Electromagnetics
description: Numerical methods for solving Maxwell equations both static and electrodynamics, introduction to finite difference, finite element and integral equation methods, and applied linear algebra.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3010; or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 715 or 813.

title: Fundamentals of Semiconductors for Microelectronics and Photonics
description: Crystal structure, semiconductor energy band structure, electron transport and carrier recombination, heterostructures, optical and dielectric properties
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3030, or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 730

title: Semiconductor Device Characterization and Modeling Lab
description: Laboratory course in material characterization, device fabrication, testing and modeling.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3030, or Grad standing in Engr or Physics.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 5194.17

title: Feedback Control Engineering for Social Justice
description: Models of individual and group poverty and underdevelopment; computational social justice; assessing social impact of technology; sensitivity analysis for technology prioritization and design; feedback control for computer automation of helping to meet social justice objectives. Feedback control for organizational diversity, optimal diverse team formation and functioning.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Jr, Sr or Grad standing in College of Engineering; or permission of instructor.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 5194.06.

title: State-Space Control Systems
description: Discrete-time state variable representations; pole placement via state-feedback; introduction to realization theory; observer design; introduction to Kalman filtering; linear quadratic regulator theory.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 3050 and Stat 3470; or Grad standing.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 650, 750, or 755.

title: Autonomy in Vehicles
description: First course on automated driving vehicles and their sub-systems; automated driving history and architectures;car following control; steering control for path tracking, lane keeping; collision mitigation and avoidance;localization and situational awareness; lower and higher-level decision making including deep learning;connected vehicle technologies; evaluation of autonomous driving function
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 3551 or ECE 551 or ECE 5551 or graduate standing in engineering.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 753.02.

title: Powertrain Control Systems
description: Application of digital control system theory, from viewpoints of input-output and state variable representations, to realistic problems in automotive powertrain systems.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3551, 5551, or 551, or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 753.01.

title: Securing Autonomous Systems
description: The course covers different security measures for safeguarding against cyberattacks, detecting cyberattacks, and mitigating the effects of cyberattacks on autonomous control systems.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3050 and 3551; or Grad standing in Engineering, Math, or Statistics.

title: Advanced Hardware Architecture Design Techniques
description:
This course introduces highly-practical methodologies and techniques that can be broadly used to improve the
			efficiency and achieve speed-area-power tradeoffs in the design of application-specific hardware implementation architectures for
			various algorithms. Efficient implementation architectures of commonly used arithmetic and digital signal processing functional blocks will also be discussed.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 2050, and prereq or concur: 3561 or 3050; or Grad standing in Engr; or permission of instructor.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 5194.08.

title: Introduction to Cybersecurity
description: Introduction to cybersecurity. Technical fundamentals of data, software, component, network, and system security. Cybersecurity from an organizational and societal view point, including human factors.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Junior, senior, or grad standing, or permission of instructor.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for CSE 5471. Cross-listed with CSE 5471.

title: Reverse Engineering and Malware Analysis
description: The course will give students an overview of cutting-edge reverse engineering techniques as well as software security and defense practices. Programming experience in C required.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq or concur: ECE 5561.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for CSE 5477.02. Cross-listed in CSE 5477.02.

title: Antiracist Technology
description: Discrimination against racial and ethnic minorities is prevalent, systemic, and global. Racism and racial justice principles are outlined. Case studies on racist technologies, those that promote or sustain racism, are studied. Engineering design methodology is used to modify or create several new technologies that help the antiracist oppose racism.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: ENGR 1182 or 1282 or graduate engineering standing or permission of instructor.

title: Photovoltaics and Energy Conversion
description: Photovoltaic materials and devices; solar cell device physics; solar cell simulation, design and operation; silicon cell technologies; thin film technologies; III-V technologies; nanostructures; terrestrial and space applications.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 3030, or MatScEn 3271, or grad standing in Engr or Physics.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 835.01.

title: Organic and Printed Flexible Electronics
description: Conducting organic small molecules and polymers (structural, optical and electrical properties); printable metal-oxide semiconductors; Printing techniques, organic light emitting diodes; transport and carrier injection; organic transistors; organic lasers.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq 3030, or MatScEn 3271, permission of instructor for non-ECE majors; or Grad standing in engineering, biological sciences, or math and physical sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 7833 or 5194.04.

title: Probability and Random Variables
description: Probability, random variables, and random vectors for analysis and research in electrical engineering. Distribution functions, characteristic functions, functions of random variables and vectors, Markov chains.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Grad standing.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 804 or 805.

title: Electromagnetic Field Theory I
description: Maxwell's Equations; plane waves; field representations and solutions in unbounded space; waveguides and cavities; elements of Green's Functions; cylindrical and spherical waves; electromagnetic theorems.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: ECE 5010 or ECE 713, and ECE 5011 or ECE 613, or graduate standing in engineering or biological sciences or math & physical sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 719, ECE 810, or ECE 811.

title: Bioelectromagnetics
description: This course provides an introduction to the inter-disciplinary field of bioelectromagnetics for graduate students. Lectures cover the interaction of electromagnetic fields with biological tissues across the frequency spectrum; bioelectromagnetic dosimetry; and various applications of bioelectromagnetics (medical, consumer, and more).
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Graduate standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, Mathematical and Physical Sciences; or permission of instructor.

title: Project Management in Electrical and Computer Engineering
description: Students learn project management principles and apply them to Electrical and Computer Engineering real-world projects.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq:  Grad standing in Electrical and Computer Engineering.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 6194.02.

title: Computer Communication Networks
description: Foundational understanding of network analysis, error-control, routing, congestion-control, multi-access, and their examples in the context of the existing communication networks.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Undergraduate course in probability or Stat 3470 or Math 530 or Stat 428 or Stat 520 or ECE 6001 or ECE 804. Cross-listed in CSE 6461
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 861, ECE 862, CSE 861, CSE 862 or CSE 6461.

title: Wireless Networks
description: Design principles and communication algorithms for wireless networks with a focus on MAC and routing protocols, scheduling algorithms, power control, and scaling properties.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: none
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for both 867 and 894.03.

title: Individual Studies in Electrical and Computer Engineering
description: Individual studies project.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq:  Permission of instructor.
exclusions: Repeatable to a maximum of 12.0 cr hrs or 12 completions. This course is graded S/U.

title: Stochastic Signal Processing
description: Spectrum estimation, array processing, adaptive filtering.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 800 or 801.01.

title: Design and Process Integration for Wide Band Gap Power Devices
description: Design and processing of wide band gap power devices (including SiC, GaN and ultra wide band gap semiconductors) and reliability considerations. 2D device simulations, layout considerations for power chip design, optimization of performance and reliability/qualification for various voltage ranges from 600 V to 15 kV.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Grad standing in Engineering or Physics.
exclusions: Not open to student with credit for 6234.

title: Introduction to Photogrammetry
description:
Analytical and digital photogrammetry, bundle block adjustment, analytical camera calibration,
			aerotriangulation, image acquisition systems, GPS controlled aerotriangulation, quality control and network
			design, DEMs and orthophotography.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Graduate level enrollment in the College of Engineering; or permission of instructor. Knowledge of linear algebra expected.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for CivilEn 6451. Cross-listed with CivilEn 6451.

title: Convex and Stochastic Network Optimization
description: Convex and stochastic optimization theory and algorithms applied to selected electrical engineering application areas.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Grad standing. Not open to students with credit for 7100.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 7100.

title: Nonlinear Optics
description: Nonlinear optics for the generation, propagation, amplification, and control of laser light; all-optical switching and solitons; modern applications in high speed lightwave devices and systems.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: 5012, or Grad standing.

title: Fundamentals of Semiconductor Devices
description: An overview of the physics, design, and engineering of semiconductor electronic and optoelectronic devices. Applications of silicon, compound semiconductor, and nanotechnology will be covered.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 5530 (730), or permission of instructor.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 5531.

title: Nanofabrication & Nanoscale Devices
description: Fundamentals of nanostructures and devices; engineering and physics of new devices, confined structures in low dimensions and their effects on traditional devices; nanofabrication and nanomanufacturing.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: ECE 6531, 5531, or 730 or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 5532 (835.03).

title: Infrared Detector and Systems
description: This course will cover the basics of infrared photodetectors and systems. It will include basic geometrical optics, radiometry, figures of merit and types of infrared detectors.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 5530, or permission of instructor.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 5194.10.

title: Semiconductor Optoelectronic Devices
description: This course will cover the basics and physics of semiconductor optoelectronic devices including light-emitting diodes, semiconductor lasers, photodetectors, and solar cells.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Grad standing in engineering or physics.

title: Advanced Topics in Sustainable Energy and Power Systems
description: Advanced topics in sustainable energy and power systems; basic issues and solutions to sustainable energy; the concept of smart grid; cyber control and security.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: ECE 5025 (624) or 724.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 5541.

title: Linear System Theory
description: In-depth treatment of linear dynamical systems. State equations solution. Controllability and observability. Canonical forms. Internal and external stability. Linear feedback and observer design. Geometric theory.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisites: ECE 5551 or ECE 551 or graduate standing in engineering or math & physical sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 5750 (750).

title: Nonlinear Systems Theory
description: Provides fundamental mathematical tools for the analysis of nonlinear dynamical systems. Basic techniques for the synthesis of nonlinear control systems are introduced.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: none listed
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 5754.

title: Research for Thesis
description: Research for thesis.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Repeatable to a maximum of 15.0 cr hrs or 30 completions. This course is graded S/U.

title: Stochastic Processes, Detection, and Estimation
description: Stochastic processes; detection and decision theory; hypothesis testing, parameter estimation; applications to communications and signal processing.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 6001 or ECE 804.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 806.

title: Wireless Communication Theory
description: Theory and analysis of wireless communication systems. Topics include: multipath fading channels; modulation, equalization, and coding for fading channels; MIMO systems; capacity calculations.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 804 or ECE 6001.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 807 or 809.

title: Information Theory
description: Mathematical models for channels and sources: entropy, information, data compression, channel capacity, Shannon's theorems, rate distortion theory.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 804 or ECE 6001.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 801.02

title: Electromagnetic Field Theory II
description: Green's functions with applications; spectral representation of sources; sources in layered media and Sommerfeld integrals; time-domain fields, retarded potentials, and transients; periodic structures; integral equations.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 719 or ECE 6010.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 810 and ECE 811.

title: Computational Electromagnetics
description: Advanced topics in numerical methods for solving Maxwell equations, including finite element methods, integral equation methods, and their hybridization.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 715 or ECE 5510 or ECE 6010
exclusions: Not open to student with credit for ECE 813 or ECE 814.

title: Advanced Data Converters and Phase-Locked Loops
description: A comprehensive overview of the most recent system architectures of data converters and phase-locked loops.  Provides a good understanding how performance specifications and process technology limitations lead to implementation decisions.  The presented principles are illustrated by examples and real life case studies.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 5021 or 5023, or permission of instructor.

title: Advanced RF Integrated Circuits
description: Advanced topics on RF and mm-wave circuits. Frequency synthesizers, transmitter linearization techniques (e.g. polar circuits),  MIMO and phase array circuits, power D/As.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 620 or ECE 5022 or graduate standing in engineering or biological sciences or math & physical sciences.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 694K or ECE 694.02.

title: High Speed Interface Circuits and Systems Design
description: Analysis and design of link architectures and circuits for wireline communication systems. Emphasis on design intuition, link budgeting and power/performance trade-offs in implementation of data links in advanced CMOS process. Topics include channel characterization, noise analysis, equalization, transmitter and receiver circuits, signaling schemes, clocking, synchronization and timing recovery.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq or concur: 5020 and 5021, or permission of instructor.

title: Advanced Topics in Analog VLSI Design
description: Advanced topics in analog VLSI design, such as integrated data converters, or power management integrated circuits, or high-performance analog circuits. This includes: system and circuit architectures, performance metrics, practical implementations, design considerations in advanced semiconductor processes, chip design projects, and lab characterization.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq or concur: 5021 and 5227; or Grad standing in Engineering, or Math and Physical Sciences, and permission of instructor. Repeatable to a maximum of 8 cr hrs

title: Physical Electronics of Advanced Semiconductor Devices
description: MOSCAPs, Gated Diode, CMOS Bulk/SOI Transistors, Photodiodes, Carrier Transport/Storage, Scaling, Mobility, CCDs, CMOS, EEPROMs, SiGe, SiC, ISFETs, BJTs, Noise and Modeling.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 894 (Spring 12, Class number 26147) or 8194.04.

title: Discrete Stochastic Processes
description: Stochastic processes in discrete time or space for electrical engineering. Renewal theory, Markov chains and processes, dynamic programming, basic large deviations theory and martingales.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 804 or ECE 6001.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 894Q or ECE 894.01.

title: Reinforcement Learning
description: Fundamentals of Markov decision processes and reinforcement learning algorithms.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Grad standing in Engineering or Math. Cross-listed in ISE.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ISE 7202.

title: Advanced Machine Learning for Remote Sensing Image Interpretation
description: Introduces basic high-resolution remote sensing concepts with focus on optical remote sensing, and computational solutions for typical remote sensing problems. Students are assumed to know basic knowledge in statistical estimation, linear algebra and numerical methods for engineering. Students with prior experiences on remote sensing/machine learning/computer vision will find this easier to follow
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Graduate standing, or instructor permission. Cross-listed with CivilEn 7421.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for CivilEn 7421.

title: Epitaxial Heterostructures (cross-listed with MSE)
description: Science and techniques behind thin film growth and engineering for combining different materials, altering chemical composition at the nanometer scale, while controlling defects and strain. Epitaxial crystal growth will be explained. Students will gain an understanding of the kinetics, thermodynamics, and technology involved in epitaxial heterostructures and self-assembled nanostructures.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq:  Grad standing.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for MSE 7531. Cross-listed in MSE.

title: Advanced Antenna Theory and Design
description: Topics in Advanced Antenna Theory and Design
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 5011 or 613, or Grad standing in Engineering, Biological Sciences, or Math and Physical Sciences
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 815.

title: Microwave Remote Sensing
description: Description of microwave remote sensing systems. Theories of scattering from random media and rough surfaces.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 6010.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 816.

title: Mixed Signal Verification and CAD Tools
description: Principles of combining analog, RF, and digital design, simulation, and verification strategies using modern CAD tools
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 622 or ECE 720 or ECE 5020.
exclusions: Not open to students  with credit for ECE 894Z or ECE 822.

title: Advanced Nonlinear Microwave Circuit Engineering
description: Large-signal characterization and modeling of nonlinear RF circuits; power amplifiers; oscillators; modulators; wideband linearization, power efficient design.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 723 or ECE 5027.
exclusions: Not open to students with credits in ECE 694.02 or ECE 694K.

title: High speed Semiconductor Devices
description: Principles of microwave semiconductor devices; scattering and high-field transport; Gunn effect; FET wave equation, HEMT; HBT; large signal RF modeling and measurements; noise; traps; self-heating.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Grad standing in Engr or Physics.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 832.

title: Advanced Topics in Power Electronics
description: Advanced topics of power electronics, beginning with utility and vehicle applications and evolving into advanced circuit topologies and control.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 624 or ECE 5025.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 844.

title: Advanced Topics in Electric Machines
description: Advanced topics of electric machines, beginning with dynamic modeling and principles of vector control and evolving into new design and control of electric machines for advanced traction motors and renewable energy generator systems.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 5041 and 5025, or permission of instructor.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 743, 744, or 845.

title: Advanced Topics in Power Systems
description: Advanced topics of power system protection, beginning with equipment protection and evolving into system wide protection design and operation to accommodate smart-grid technologies.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite; ECE 5042 or 740.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 741.

title: Intelligent Control
description: Fuzzy control, neural control, genetic algorithms, learning control, and distributed intelligent control
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: 5551 (551) or equiv.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for ECE 858.

title: Scientific Computing on Emerging Architectures
description: Introduction to the architectural system design of emerging architectures and techniques for managing idiosyncrasies of these architectures for developing scientific computing applications.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 694J or 694.03.

title: Computer Vision
description: Computer vision systems, image models, feature extraction, shape representation and recognition, object modeling and recognition, matching, probabilistic and statistical modeling, semantic knowledge, face perception.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for 863.

title: Advanced Topics in Communications
description: Current topics in information theory and the practice of digital communications.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 6001.
exclusions: Repeatable to a maximum of 6 cr hrs.

title: Advanced Topics in Electromagnetics and Optics
description: Topics are chosen to prepare graduate students for research and application in current problems in electromagnetics and optics.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 719 or ECE 6010.

title: Advanced Topics in Networks
description: Advanced topics and new areas of interest in the theory of networking and networked systems.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 804 or ECE 6001.

title: Individual Studies in Electrical and Computer Engineering
description: Individual studies project.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq:  Permission of instructor.
exclusions: Repeatable to a maximum of 12.0 cr hrs or 12 completions. This course is graded S/U.

title: Advanced Topics in Signal Processing
description: Current topics in the theory and practice of signal processing.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: ECE 806 or ECE 7001.

title: Continuous Time Optimal Control
description: Embraces the three historical trends in dynamic optimization: Calculus of Variations, Pontryagin's Minimum Principle, and Bellman's Principle of Optimality. Not only mathematical aspects of the three principles will be taught, but also their strengths and weaknesses - it is often less important to know how to apply a given principle than to know when.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Cross-listed with ME8220.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for MechEng 8220.

title: Robust Multi-Variable Control with Applications
description: Advanced concepts for robust control of uncertain dynamic systems with applications.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: 6750 or AERO 5620 or AERO 5621 or instructor permission.Cross-Listings: AERO 8850.
exclusions: Not open to students with credit for AERO 8850

title: Advanced Topics in Control Theory
description: Current topics in control theory, optimization, and decision theory.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Permission of instructor.
exclusions: Repeatable to a maximum of 6.0 credit hours or 2 completions.

title: Special Topics on Computational Modeling
description: Reviews the latest computational models and advanced methods for modeling processes of diverse sorts.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Reviews the latest computational models and advanced methods for modeling processes of diverse sorts.

title: Special Topics in Advanced Computer Design Methodologies
description: Design automation, computer aided design, testing, and design for energy efficiency.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Grad standing in Engineering. Repeatable to a maximum of 9 cr hrs.

title: Seminar in Electrical and Computer Engineering
description: Seminar in electrical and computer engineering.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Graduate standing in electrical and computer engineering. Repeatable to a maximum of 12.0 cr hrs or 6 completions. This course is graded S/U.

title: Open Graduate Seminar
description: As an introduction to potential research areas, students will attend OSU sponsored talks relevant to topics in Electrical Engineering and cr4itique them by written reports.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Graduate standing in electrical and computer engineering. Repeatable to a maximum of 6.0 cr hrs or 6 completions. This course is graded S/U.

title: Graduate Research in Electrical and Computer Engineering
description: Supervised graduate research in various topics. Not for thesis or dissertation.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Grad standing in ECE.

title: Graduate Research in Electrical and Computer Engineering
description: Supervised graduate research in various topics. Not for thesis or dissertation.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Prereq: Grad standing in ECE.

title: Research for Dissertation
description: Research for dissertation.
subject: Electrical and Computer Engineering
prerequisites: Repeatable to a maximum of 30 completions. This course is graded S/U.
